title: mediawiki/page/undelete
description: Represents a MW Page Undelete (restore) event.

$schema.description: A URI identifying the JSONSchema for this event. This should match an schema's $id in a schema repository. E.g. /schema/title/1.0.0

uri.description: Unique URI identifying the event or entity

request_id.description: Unique ID of the request that caused the event

dt.description: UTC event datetime, in ISO-8601 format

domain.description: Domain the event or entity pertains to

stream.description: Name of the stream/queue/dataset that this event belongs in

database.description: The name of the wiki database this event entity belongs to.

performer.description: Represents the user that performed this change.

user_id.description: The user id that performed this change.  This is optional, and will not be present for anonymous users.

user_text.description: The text representation of the user that performed this change.

user_groups.description: A list of the groups this user belongs to.  E.g. bot, sysop etc.

user_is_bot.description: True if this user is considered to be a bot at the time of this event. This is checked via the $user->isBot() method, which considers both user_groups and user permissions.

user_registration_dt.description: The datetime of the user account registration. Not present for anonymous users or if missing in the MW database.

user_edit_count.description: The number of edits this user has made at the time of this event. Not present for anonymous users.

page_title.description: The normalized title of the page.

page_namespace.description: The namespace ID this page belongs to.

page_is_redirect.description: True if this page is currently a redirect page.  This fact is ultimately represented by revision content containing redirect wikitext.  If rev_id's content has redirect wikitext, then this page is a redirect.  Note that this state is also stored on the Mediawiki page table.

rev_id.description: The head revision of the page at the time of this event.

comment.description: The comment left by the user that performed this change.

parsedcomment.description: The comment left by the user that performed this change parsed into simple HTML. Optional

prior_state.description: The prior state of the entity before this event. If a top level entity field is not present in this object, then its value has not changed since the prior event.  If prior_state itself is not present, then this event had no relevant prior state, indicating that it is probably the first time this type has been emitted for this entity. For page undeletes, prior_state will be absent unless the page_id is no longer the same as the page_id it had before it was deleted.

page_id.description: The page ID before this restore as it was in the archive table.
